availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William B. Maxey (Monroe County, Kentucky, soldier)

body.p: Monroe County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Robert C. Maxey and Augustine Maxey. Farmer in Monroe County in 1865. Farm laborer in Monroe County in 1860. Private in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.). Prisoner of War from June 9, 1863, to June 16, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 394A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 2.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0002.
Selected Records of the War Department Relating to Confederate Prisoners of War, 1861-1865, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M598, (accessed via ancestry.com).
